verses.verse: Canst thou draw out <S%H4900><s%> leviathan <S%H3882><s%> with an hook <S%H2443><s%>? or his tongue <S%H3956><s%> with a cord <S%H2256><s%> which thou lettest down <S%H8257><s%>? leviathan: That is, a whale or a whirlepoole which: Heb. which thou drownest?
Canst thou put <S%H7760><s%> an hook <S%H100><s%> into his nose <S%H639><s%>? or bore <S%H5344><s%> his jaw <S%H3895><s%> through with a thorn <S%H2336><s%>?
Will he make many <S%H7235><s%> supplications <S%H8469><s%> unto thee? will he speak <S%H1696><s%> soft <S%H7390><s%> words unto thee?
Will he make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with thee? wilt thou take <S%H3947><s%> him for a servant <S%H5650><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>?
Wilt thou play <S%H7832><s%> with him as with a bird <S%H6833><s%>? or wilt thou bind <S%H7194><s%> him for thy maidens <S%H5291><s%>?
Shall the companions <S%H2271><s%> make a banquet <S%H3739><s%> of him? shall they part <S%H2673><s%> him among the merchants <S%H3669><s%>?
Canst thou fill <S%H4390><s%> his skin <S%H5785><s%> with barbed irons <S%H7905><s%>? or his head <S%H7218><s%> with fish <S%H1709><s%> spears <S%H6767><s%>?
Lay <S%H7760><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> upon him, remember <S%H2142><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%>, do no more <S%H3254><s%>.
Behold, the hope <S%H8431><s%> of him is in vain <S%H3576><s%>: shall not one be cast down <S%H2904><s%> even at the sight <S%H4758><s%> of him?
None is so fierce <S%H393><s%> that dare stir him up <S%H5782><s%> <S%H5782><s%>: who then is able to stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me?
Who hath prevented <S%H6923><s%> me, that I should repay <S%H7999><s%> him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven <S%H8064><s%> is mine.
I will not conceal <S%H2790><s%> his parts <S%H907><s%>, nor his power <S%H1369><s%> <S%H1697><s%>, nor his comely <S%H2433><s%> proportion <S%H6187><s%>.
Who can discover <S%H1540><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of his garment <S%H3830><s%>? or who can come <S%H935><s%> to him with his double <S%H3718><s%> bridle <S%H7448><s%>? with: or, within
Who can open <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%>? his teeth <S%H8127><s%> are terrible <S%H367><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%>.
His scales <S%H4043><s%> <S%H650><s%> are his pride <S%H1346><s%>, shut up together <S%H5462><s%> as with a close <S%H6862><s%> seal <S%H2368><s%>. scales: Heb. strong pieces of shields
One <S%H259><s%> is so near <S%H5066><s%> to another <S%H259><s%>, that no air <S%H7307><s%> can come <S%H935><s%> between them.
They are joined <S%H1692><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another <S%H251><s%>, they stick together <S%H3920><s%>, that they cannot be sundered <S%H6504><s%>.
By his neesings <S%H5846><s%> a light <S%H216><s%> doth shine <S%H1984><s%>, and his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like the eyelids <S%H6079><s%> of the morning <S%H7837><s%>.
Out of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> burning lamps <S%H3940><s%>, and sparks <S%H3590><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> leap out <S%H4422><s%>.
Out of his nostrils <S%H5156><s%> goeth <S%H3318><s%> smoke <S%H6227><s%>, as out of a seething <S%H5301><s%> pot <S%H1731><s%> or caldron <S%H100><s%>.
His breath <S%H5315><s%> kindleth <S%H3857><s%> coals <S%H1513><s%>, and a flame <S%H3851><s%> goeth out <S%H3318><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
In his neck <S%H6677><s%> remaineth <S%H3885><s%> strength <S%H5797><s%>, and sorrow <S%H1670><s%> is turned into joy <S%H1750><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him. is turned into joy: Heb. rejoiceth
The flakes <S%H4651><s%> of his flesh <S%H1320><s%> are joined together <S%H1692><s%>: they are firm <S%H3332><s%> in themselves; they cannot be moved <S%H4131><s%>. flakes: Heb. fallings
His heart <S%H3820><s%> is as firm <S%H3332><s%> as a stone <S%H68><s%>; yea, as hard <S%H3332><s%> as a piece <S%H6400><s%> of the nether <S%H8482><s%> millstone.
When he raiseth up <S%H7613><s%> himself, the mighty <S%H352><s%> are afraid <S%H1481><s%>: by reason of breakings <S%H7667><s%> they purify <S%H2398><s%> themselves.
The sword <S%H2719><s%> of him that layeth <S%H5381><s%> at him cannot hold <S%H6965><s%>: the spear <S%H2595><s%>, the dart <S%H4551><s%>, nor the habergeon <S%H8302><s%>. habergeon: or, breastplate
He esteemeth <S%H2803><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%> as straw <S%H8401><s%>, and brass <S%H5154><s%> as rotten <S%H7539><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%>.
The arrow <S%H1121><s%> <S%H7198><s%> cannot make him flee <S%H1272><s%>: slingstones <S%H68><s%> <S%H7050><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> with him into stubble <S%H7179><s%>.
Darts <S%H8455><s%> are counted <S%H2803><s%> as stubble <S%H7179><s%>: he laugheth <S%H7832><s%> at the shaking <S%H7494><s%> of a spear <S%H3591><s%>.
Sharp <S%H2303><s%> stones <S%H2789><s%> are under him: he spreadeth <S%H7502><s%> sharp pointed things <S%H2742><s%> upon the mire <S%H2916><s%>. Sharp stones: Heb. Sharp pieces of potsherd
He maketh the deep <S%H4688><s%> to boil <S%H7570><s%> like a pot <S%H5518><s%>: he maketh <S%H7760><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> like a pot of ointment <S%H4841><s%>.
He maketh a path <S%H5410><s%> to shine <S%H215><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him; one would think <S%H2803><s%> the deep <S%H8415><s%> to be hoary <S%H7872><s%>.
Upon earth <S%H6083><s%> there is not his like <S%H4915><s%>, who is made <S%H6213><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> fear <S%H2844><s%>. is made without fear: or, behave themselves without fear
He beholdeth <S%H7200><s%> all high <S%H1364><s%> things: he is a king <S%H4428><s%> over all the children <S%H1121><s%> of pride <S%H7830><s%>.
